intro: Orthosiphon natalensis, commonly known as Natal senna, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Orthosiphon natalensis is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
